item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1434; 07:15PM; 8333 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tpaRIV; Panorama City; KNOCKDOWN: Over 70 firefighters extinguished the fire in 53 minutes. The building is updated to a four story commercial (Walmart) with fire on the 2nd floor. The fire sprinkler system activated and there is now a significant water removal operation underway. Four patients were evaluated and declined LAFD transport. LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation. LA Dept of Building and Safety and LA County Dept of Public Health were notified. Cause and $ loss TBD. LAFD PIO Captain Silverman will be on scene for media availability. No further details.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 BC14 CM42 E239 E27 E275 E288 E290 E298 E7 E81 E89 EM14 RA839 RA90 RA98 T39 T75 T88 T90 T98; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1434; 06:22PM; 8333 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tpaRIV; Panorama City; Two story commercial building (DBA Walmart) with a contents fire on the 2nd floor being held in check by a sprinkler. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC12 E239 E290 E298 E7 E81 RA839 RA90 T39 T90 T98; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1376; 06:15PM; 5701 S Avalon; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ud6krV; South Park; *Updated Address* KNOCKDOWN 29 firefighters extinguished the fire in 26 minutes. The fire was contained to the attic and prevented from extending down into the living space. No injuries reported. No further details.; FS 21; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E21 E221 E233 E266 E33 RA21 RA833 SQ21 T33 T66; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Trench Rescue; INC#1002; 02:47PM; 10865 W Bluffside Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wk9Xix; Studio City; Firefighters safely extricated the two patients were safely extricated from the trench. Both patients are being transported in unknown condition. CAL-OSHA has been notified. No further details.; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 BC14 CM42 E27 E288 E289 E76 E86 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA89 T88 T89 UR27 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Trench Rescue; INC#1002; 02:03PM; 10865 W Bluffside Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wk9Xix; Studio City; Firefighters are working to remove debris from two patients located approximately 3' down in a trench. The patients (age/gender unknown) are currently conscious and talking. The extent of possible injuries is undetermined at this time. LAFD Urban Search and Rescue resources are enroute.; FS 86; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 BC14 E27 E288 E289 E76 E86 EM14 HR3 RA60 RA89 T88 T89 UR27 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

FINAL UPDATE Hazardous Materials; INC#0388; 11:54AM; 4541 W Electronics Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u5FP83; Atwater Village; FINAL UPDATE: At 8:38AM the LAFD responded to a Hazardous Materials incident at the Huntsman Chemical facility at 4541 W Electronics Place. After a thorough investigation, the following was determined: The product “Reninfusion 8610” (a one-component epoxy system) was being processed for transport and a small valve broke which caused the release of a cloud. The leak was contained (there was a limited amount of product) and when LAFD Hazardous Materials Specialists made entry with gas meters, no reading of concern registered. Residents in areas affected by the dissipating cloud who experienced any medical distress are recommended to seek medical advice through their health care provider. The product’s corrosive hazards are with direct contact when it’s in a liquid state. No workers on scene exhibited any medical complaints. LAFD has no further information for this incident. LA County Health Hazardous Materials is handling the investigation with South Coast Air Quality Management District (AQMD). *NOTE* It was later learned the release was made by a pressure relief valve which operated as designed (not a broken valve) when the vessel overheated while the product was being processed. ; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0388; 10:30AM; 4541 W Electronics Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u5FP83; Atwater Village; A metal vessel was being prepared for packaging/distribution and a small valve broke, expelling gas into the air creating a small cloud which rapidly dissipated. There was no fire, no explosion, no injuries and no medical complaints. The building was evacuated as a precaution (no other evacuations were mandated). Hazardous Materials firefighters made entry with specialized gas meters and determined there is no current threat - there were no readings of concern on the meters. Residents in the area detecting an unusual odor have been recommended to shelter in place (closing doors and windows). If they wish to leave the area, the recommended direction of travel is South of the incident (location is shown in the map link in this alert). The incident is now downgrading with most resources being released. The business involved is Huntsman Chemical. No further details at this time.; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC14 BC2 BC5 CE83 CM21 CM22 E11 E201 E209 E21 E221 E235 E250 E287 E42 E56 E87 E90 EA1 EM2 H6 HA6 HL9 HM75 JT1 JT2 JT3 JT6 PI1 PI2 RA13 RA21 RA35 RA39 RA55 RA56 RA87 SQ21 SQ87 T1 T21 T35 T87 T9 UA1 UA6; CH7; 13 14 15; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0388; 09:48AM; 4541 W Electronics Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u5FP83; Atwater Village; Firefighters are continuing to investigate and work to mitigate any hazards involved. This type of incident is inherently detailed and technical, which takes time. The HazMat Squad members are preparing to make entry into the involved area. There was no and remains no fire. This is a static incident in that no additional leaks/releases etc are occurring. There remain no reported injuries. For any residents in the area smelling an odor and wishing to evacuate (current recommendation is to shelter in place), they are advised to travel South of Electronics Place (see the link in this alert for map of the incident location). ; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC2 BC5 CE83 CM22 E201 E209 E21 E221 E235 E250 E287 E42 E56 E87 E90 EA1 EM2 H6 HA6 HM75 JT1 JT2 JT3 JT6 PI1 PI2 RA21 RA35 RA55 RA56 RA87 SQ21 SQ87 T1 T21 T35 T87 T9 UA1; CH9; 13 14 15; Margaret Stewart

Hazardous Materials; INC#0388; 08:38AM; 4541 W Electronics Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u5FP83; Atwater Village; This incident was initially received as an 'automatic fire alarm' (there was no fire involved) and the first responding fire company upgraded it to a Hazardous Materials response with additional requested resources enroute. The business is "Huntsman Chemical" and there was an incident reportedly during the transport of a product, which resulted in a leak (no further details on the occurrence available at this time). The involved building has been evacuated and there are currently no reported injuries. LAFD HazMat Squads (2) are responding for the investigation and handling of any potential hazards. The plant manager is on scene, assisting firefighters. No further details.; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC2 BC5 CM22 E201 E209 E21 E221 E235 E250 E287 E42 E56 E87 EM2 HM75 JT1 JT2 JT3 RA35 RA55 RA56 RA87 SQ21 SQ87 T1 T21 T35 T87 T9; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart
